publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6921 Ian McKee: Sexual Health Week 2010—That the Parliament welcomes the Family Planning Association’s (FPA) Sexual Health Week, to be held this year between 13 and 19 September; notes that the 2010 campaign will focus on raising awareness about sexually transmitted infections (STIs) in people over 50; further notes that the campaign was prompted by rising levels of STIs among over 50s considered in part to be a result of an increasing number of people starting new relationships later in life, and fully supports the FPA campaign to promote safer sex regardless of age. Supported by: Robin Harper*, Sandra White*, Jackie Baillie*, Jackson Carlaw*, Kenneth Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*
S3M-6921 Sexual Health Week 2010 (lodged on 6 September 2010) Ken Macintosh*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Bill Kidd*, Mary Scanlon*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-6921 Ian McKee: Sexual Health Week 2010—That the Parliament welcomes the Family Planning Association’s (FPA) Sexual Health Week, to be held this year between 13 and 19 September; notes that the 2010 campaign will focus on raising awareness about sexually transmitted infections (STIs) in people over 50; further notes that the campaign was prompted by rising levels of STIs among over 50s considered in part to be a result of an increasing number of people starting new relationships later in life, and fully supports the FPA campaign to promote safer sex regardless of age. Supported by: Robin Harper, Sandra White, Jackie Baillie, Jackson Carlaw, Kenneth Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Ken Macintosh, Rob Gibson, Bill Wilson, Jamie Hepburn, Hugh O’Donnell, Bill Kidd, Mary Scanlon, Gil Paterson, Marlyn Glen*, Dr Richard Simpson*
